description:
This Environmental Product Declaration (EPD®) describes the environmental impacts of 1 m² of glass wool with a thermal resistance equal to 1.0 K*m2*W-1. The Saint-Gobain Argentina SA -Div. ISOVER / Llavallol (Argentina) Llavallol uses natural and abundant raw materials (sand), using fusion techniques and obtaining fibers to produce glass wool. The products obtained are presented in the form of "fiberglass rolls or panels" consisting of a soft aerated structure. On Earth, naturally, the best insulator is dry still air exposed to a temperature of 20°C: its conductivity factor expressed in λ, is 0.025 W/(mK) (watts per meter degree Kelvin).The thermal conductivity of glass wool is close to that of still air since its lambda varies from 0.032 W/(mK) in its most efficient level to 0.043 W/(mK) at its least efficient level With its tangled structure, glass wool is a porous material that traps air, making it one of the best insulating materials. wool too
3absorbs airborne noise and provides acoustic correction within the facility. Glass wool contains non-combustible materials does not feed fire or spread flames. Glass wool insulation (glass wool) is used both in buildings, as well as in industrial facilities. Ensures a high level of comfort, reduces energy costs, minimizes carbon dioxide (CO2), prevents heat loss through gabled roofs, walls, floors, pipes and boilers, reduces noise pollution and protects homes and industrial facilities from the risk of fire. Glass wool products last for the life of the building (often set to 50 years by default), or as long as the insulation component of the building is part of the building.
name: Acustiver P
